intro: Epidendrum proligerum, commonly known as the profuse epidendrum, is a species of orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its compact, often densely branched growth habit and produces clusters of small, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows on trees or rocks, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually dark green and革质 (leathery), providing a sturdy structure for supporting its floral display. Epidendrum proligerum is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to adapt to various growing conditions.
